TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DateFormat extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Utility class for producing strings with formatted date/time.

remarks.para: Utility class for producing strings with formatted date/time.

Most callers should avoid supplying their own format strings to this class' format methods and rely on the correctly localized ones supplied by the system. This class' factory methods return appropriately-localized java.text.DateFormat instances, suitable for both formatting and parsing dates. For the canonical documentation of format strings, see java.text.SimpleDateFormat.
In cases where the system does not provide a suitable pattern, this class offers the #getBestDateTimePattern method.

The format methods in this class implement a subset of Unicode UTS #35 patterns. The subset currently supported by this class includes the following format characters: acdEHhLKkLMmsyz. Up to API level 17, only adEhkMmszy were supported. Note that this class incorrectly implements k as if it were H for backwards compatibility.

See java.text.SimpleDateFormat for more documentation about patterns, or if you need a more complete or correct implementation. Note that the non-format methods in this class are implemented by SimpleDateFormat.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string? GetBestDateTimePattern (Java.Util.Locale? locale, string? skeleton);
.method public static hidebysig string GetBestDateTimePattern(class Java.Util.Locale locale, string skeleton) cil managed
static member GetBestDateTimePattern : Java.Util.Locale * string -> string

Docs.param: the locale into which the skeleton should be localized
Docs.summary: Returns the best possible localized form of the given skeleton for the given locale.
Docs.returns: a string pattern suitable for use with java.text.SimpleDateFormat.

remarks.para: Returns the best possible localized form of the given skeleton for the given locale. A skeleton is similar to, and uses the same format characters as, a Unicode UTS #35 pattern.
One difference is that order is irrelevant. For example, "MMMMd" will return "MMMM d" in the en_US locale, but "d. MMMM" in the de_CH locale.
Note also in that second example that the necessary punctuation for German was added. For the same input in es_ES, we'd have even more extra text: "d 'de' MMMM".

This method will automatically correct for grammatical necessity. Given the same "MMMMd" input, this method will return "d LLLL" in the fa_IR locale, where stand-alone months are necessary. Lengths are preserved where meaningful, so "Md" would give a different result to "MMMd", say, except in a locale such as ja_JP where there is only one length of month.
This method will only return patterns that are in CLDR, and is useful whenever you know what elements you want in your format string but don't want to make your code specific to any one locale.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Java.Text.DateFormat GetDateFormat(class Android.Content.Context context) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a java.text.DateFormat object that can format the date in short form according to the context's locale.
Docs.returns: the java.text.DateFormat object that properly formats the date.

remarks.para: Returns a java.text.DateFormat object that can format the date in short form according to the context's locale.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig char[] GetDateFormatOrder(class Android.Content.Context context) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the current date format stored as a char array.

remarks.para: Gets the current date format stored as a char array. Returns a 3 element array containing the day ('d'), month ('M'), and year ('y')) in the order specified by the user's format preference. Note that this order is only appropriate for all-numeric dates; spelled-out (MEDIUM and LONG) dates will generally contain other punctuation, spaces, or words, not just the day, month, and year, and not necessarily in the same order returned here.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool Is24HourFormat(class Android.Content.Context context) cil managed

Docs.param: the context to use for the content resolver
Docs.summary: Returns true if times should be formatted as 24 hour times, false if times should be formatted as 12 hour (AM/PM) times.
Docs.returns: true if 24 hour time format is selected, false otherwise.

remarks.para: Returns true if times should be formatted as 24 hour times, false if times should be formatted as 12 hour (AM/PM) times. Based on the user's chosen locale and other preferences.
